title: Migrate @devlog/web to Next.js Full-Stack Architecture
description: Replace the current Vite + Express setup in @devlog/web with Next.js for unified full-stack development. The current architecture uses separate client (Vite/React) and server (Express) processes with WebSocket support. Need to migrate to Next.js App Router with API routes while preserving existing functionality.

notes.content: Starting migration to Next.js. Current architecture analysis complete: Vite+React client with Express API server, WebSocket support, Ant Design + TailwindCSS UI.

context.businessContext: Simplify development workflow and improve developer experience by using a single framework for both frontend and backend. Next.js provides better integration, built-in optimizations, and simplified deployment.
context.technicalContext: Current setup: Vite dev server on port 3000 proxying to Express API server on port 3001, with WebSocket support for real-time updates. Uses React + Ant Design + TailwindCSS for UI. Express server handles API routes and serves devlog data from @devlog/core package.
acceptanceCriteria: TailwindCSS and Ant Design integration maintained
Development workflow simplified to single command
